page.title: 06THE GEOGRAPHY OF OUR COUNTRY
page.content: THE HIGHEST HILL IS IN THE VERY NORTH OF OUR SQUARE AND IS 312m HIGH AND HAS A GRID REFERENCE OF 54817 THE TREES IN OUR AREA ARE MIXED WOODLAND AND ALSO CONIFEROUS E.G PINE AND FIR. THE FISH IN THE AREA IS MOSLY SALMON,SEA TROUT,AND BROWN TROUT BUT YOU CAN GET FISH LIKE PIKE,GRAILING AND MINNOS AND STICKLEBACKS AND SOMETIMES ROACH. THE DEEPEST PART OF THE RIVER IS AT HORNSHLOE AT THE 10 TONNE BRIDGE AND AT ASHYBANK.THE BIGGEST FISH IN THE AREA IS SALMON,SEA TROUT AND GRAILING.SALOMON CAN BE 6lb TO 40lb BUT MOST ARE ABOUT 27lb TO 28lb. THE RIVER EVENTUALY GOES TO JOIN THE TWEED BUT ALSO THE BORTHWICK,ALE,JEO,RULE,SLITRIG AND KALE JOINE THE TEVIET BEFORE KELSO.
